featured.text: Mortuary poles were also raised to honor the dead, but they differed from memorial poles, having a burial box placed at the top of the pole.
She sang instead at the Lincoln Memorial for over 75,000 people.
Memorial poles stood in front of a house.

definition.zh_def: 紀念物；紀念活動或儀式
definition.en_def: Something, especially a structure, established to remind people of a person or event.
definition.example: They built a memorial to honor the soldiers who fought in the war.
